(G.T. 87.) February 27th 1917.
No. 464/17/m.
Sir,
I am desired "by Monsieur Bratiano, Roumanian. Prime- Minister to invite your favourable consideration of the request made by Monsieur Bratiano to Lord Milner and General Wilson in Petrograd, Tor the supply of the Roumanian Army with the heavy artillery demanded for the Roumanian Government "by the French Government..
Monsieur Bratiano also wishes me to poiftt out how important * it is for the Roumanian Government that their requirements-should . "be integrally fulfilled and with, the greatest possible despatch,... as the heavy.artillery is absolutely and urgently necessary for the reorganisation 6t the Roumanian Army and will at the same time greatly contribute to raise the "moral" of the soldiers.
I, therefore should feel extremely obliged if you,would be so good as to consider this request at your earliest convenience and let me be informed of the steps which His Majesty's Government intend to take in the matter
Thanking you in anticipation for your support,,
I have the honour to be with the highest consideration,
Sir,
Your most obedient, humble Servant,
The Roumanian Minister
